dataset.title: GRiMeDB: a comprehensive global database of methane concentrations and fluxes in fluvial ecosystems with supporting physical and chemical information

abstract.para: The Global River Methane Database (GriMeDB) is a compilation of measurements of CH4 concentrations and fluxes for flowing water environments derived from publications, reports, data repositories, and other outlets between 1973 and 2021. Assembly of GRiMeDB was motivated by the goal of having a centralized, standardized resource to facilitate further studies of CH4 pattern and process in flowing water systems, upscaling efforts, and identification of tendencies in when, where, and how CH4 has been sampled in streams and rivers across the world. Thus, CH4 data are supported by concurrent observations (as available) of aquatic CO2, N2O, temperature, conductivity, pH, dissolved oxygen, nitrogen, phosphorus, organic carbon, and discharge, along with site data (latitude, longitude, elevation, and [as available]: stream order, elevation, channel slope, catchment size, and codes for distinct or disturbed channel types). GRiMeDB includes over 24,000 records of CH4 concentration and greater than 8,000 flux measurements from over 5,000 unique sites, most of which are resolved to the daily time scale.

intellectualRights.para: This information is released under the Creative Commons license - Attribution - CC BY (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). The consumer of these data ("Data User" herein) is required to cite it appropriately in any publication that results from its use. The Data User should realize that these data may be actively used by others for ongoing research and that coordination may be necessary to prevent duplicate publication. The Data User is urged to contact the authors of these data if any questions about methodology or results occur. Where appropriate, the Data User is encouraged to consider collaboration or co-authorship with the authors. The Data User should realize that misinterpretation of data may occur if used out of context of the original study. While substantial efforts are made to ensure the accuracy of data and associated documentation, complete accuracy of data sets cannot be guaranteed. All data are made available "as is." The Data User should be aware, however, that data are updated periodically and it is the responsibility of the Data User to check for new versions of the data. The data authors and the repository where these data were obtained shall not be liable for damages resulting from any use or misinterpretation of the data. Thank you.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Global Rivers, the scope of these data was not limited; any inland water system was eligible for inclusion

description.para: Data included in GRiMeDB were gathered from scientific journals, government reports, public data repositories, theses, dissertations, and unpublished data sets provided by individual investigators. Sources were discovered via searches of bibliographic databases and data repositories (Web of Science, Google Scholar, ProQuest Dissertations & Theses Global, China National Knowledge Infrastructure, Environmental Data Initiative, USGS ScienceBase, NERC Environmental Information Data Centre, Arctic Data Center, and PANGAEA) using the keywords: methane and stream* or river* or ditch* or canal*, and searches were repeated numerous times between 2018 and December 2021 for completeness. Detailed methods used to construct the database are presented in Stanley et al. (XXXX)
Stanley, E.H., L.C. Loken, N.J. Casson, S.K. Oliver, R.A. Sponseller, M.B. Wallin, L. Zhang, and G. Rocher-Ros. XXXX. GRiMeDB: The global river database of methane concentrations and fluxes.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Yes or No; “Yes” if there is a corresponding flux measurement associated with this site and date combination

corresponding flux measurement associated with this site

attribute.attributeDefinition: Number of samples or observations corresponding to the mean or median concentration
Minimum measured CH4 concentration if data are aggregated spatially or temporally, has multiple within-day measurements (e.g., a diel study), or are from a data-dense spatial study
Maximum measured CH4 concentration if data are aggregated or temporally, has multiple within-day measurements (e.g., a diel study), or are from a data-dense spatial study
Mean or sole reported CH4 concentration for the sampling event
Standard deviation of the mean CH4 concentration
Median CH4 concentration
Minimum measured CO2 concentration if data are aggregated or temporally, has multiple within-day measurements (e.g., a diel study), or are from a data-dense spatial study

Standard deviation of the mean concentration
Median CO2 concentration

Maximum measured N2O concentration if data are aggregated or temporally, has multiple within-day measurements (e.g., a diel study), or are from a data-dense spatial study
Mean or sole reported N2O concentration for the concentration for the sampling event
Standard deviation of the mean N2O concentration
Median N2O concentration
Water temperature in degrees C measured concurrently with CH4

Estimated water temperature in degrees C. This field was populated only for cases in which a the temperature value was needed for gas unit conversions. Most estimates were based on temperatures from adjacent sites, averaging temperatures during the prior and proceeding sample dates, or from an adjacent day of the year but from another year.
Specific conductance in ?S cm-1
pH

dataTable.entityDescription: Fluxes of methane and related gases

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique paper identifier from the Sources Table

textDomain.definition: Unique paper identifier from the Sources Table

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique paper identifier from the Sites Table

textDomain.definition: Unique paper identifier from the Sites Table

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique site name from the Sites Table

textDomain.definition: Unique site name from the Sites Table

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique name for the sampling event at the site

textDomain.definition: Unique name for the sampling event at the site

attribute.attributeDefinition: First sampling date
Last sampling date; this is the same date as the Date_start if data are not aggregated over time
Yes or No; “Yes” if CH4 data entered are averages from >1 site

codeDefinition.definition: CH4 data entered are not averages
CH4 data entered are averages from more than 1 site

attribute.attributeDefinition: Yes or No; “Yes: if CH4 data entered are averages from >1 date

codeDefinition.definition: CH4 data entered are not averages
CH4 data entered are averages from more than 1 date

attribute.attributeDefinition: Minimum measured CH4 diffusive flux if data are aggregated spatially or temporally, has multiple within-day measurements (e.g., a diel study), or are from a data-dense spatial study
Maximum measured CH4 diffusive flux if data are aggregated spatially or temporally, has multiple within-day measurements (e.g., a diel study), or are from a data-dense spatial study
Mean or sole reported CH4 diffusive flux for the sampling event
Standard deviation of the mean CH4 diffusive flux
Median CH4 diffusive flux
Number of samples or observations corresponding to the mean or median diffusive CH4 flux
Methodological category used to measure diffusive CH4 flux.

codeDefinition.definition: use of an unspecified type of chamber (suspended, tethered, or free-floating) and the pattern of change in chamber gas concentration during flux measurements is also not specified
unspecified type of chamber with a linear increase in chamber gas concentration over time or use of a linear model to calculate flux
chamber is restrained to maintain its position during flux measurement; pattern of change in chamber gas concentration during flux measurements is not specified
chamber is restrained to maintain its position during flux measurement; linear increase in chamber gas concentration over time or use of a linear model to calculate flux
chamber is unrestrained and is able to float downstream during flux measurement; the pattern of change in chamber gas concentration during flux measurements is not specified
chamber is unrestrained and is able to float downstream during flux measurement; linear increase in chamber gas concentration over time or use of a linear model to calculate flux
diffusive flux calculated using a gas exchange coefficient (k) and the difference between measured CH4 concentration and CH4 concentration in equilibrium with the atmosphere
methods other than those described above

attribute.attributeDefinition: Minimum measured CH4 ebullitive flux if data are aggregated spatially or temporally, has multiple within-day measurements (e.g., a diel study), or are from a data-dense spatial study
Maximum measured CH4 ebullitive flux if data are aggregated spatially or temporally, has multiple within-day measurements (e.g., a diel study), or are from a data-dense spatial study
Mean or sole reported CH4 ebullitive flux for the sampling event
Standard deviation of the mean CH4 ebullitive flux
Median CH4 ebullition flux
Number of samples or observations corresponding to the mean or median ebullitive CH4 flux
Methodological category used to measure ebullitive CH4 flux.

codeDefinition.definition: ebullition calculated as chamber-measured flux (assumed to be total CH4 flux) minus diffusive flux calculated from the ‘conc+k’ method
gas released by ebullition captured in traps to quantify total gas volume; volume data combined with measurement of gas content of recently collected bubbles
gas bubble volume determined using echosounder and combined with measurements of gas bubble content

codeDefinition.code: departure from linear increase during measurement
codeDefinition.definition: non-linear change in gas concentrations during chamber-based flux measurements taken as evidence of ebullition; various approaches used to quantify ebullition from these departures

attribute.attributeDefinition: Minimum measured total CH4 flux if data are aggregated spatially or temporally, has multiple within-day measurements (e.g., a diel study), or are from a data-dense spatial study
Maximum measured total CH4 flux if data are aggregated spatially or temporally, has multiple within-day measurements (e.g., a diel study), or are from a data-dense spatial study
Mean or sole reported total CH4 flux for the sampling event
Standard deviation of the mean total CH4 flux
Median measured total CH4 flux
Methodological category used to measure total CH4 flux

codeDefinition.definition: total flux calculated as the sum of separate measurements of diffusion determined by the conc+k method plus ebullition determined from the bubble trap or echosounder approach combined with bubble gas analysis
free-floating chamber is assumed to capture diffusive flux and ebullitive flux (if present)
suspended or tethered chamber is assumed to capture diffusive flux and ebullitive flux (if present)

total flux calculated as the sum of separate measurements of diffusion determined using a floating or suspended/tethered chamber plus ebullition determined from the bubble trap or echosounder approach combined with bubble gas analysis

total flux represents the difference between all measured inputs to a reach (e.g., dissolved CH4 from upstream flow, groundwater discharge, and methanogenesis) minus all outputs other than efflux to the atmosphere (e.g., downstream export, methane oxidation)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Minimum measured CO2 flux if data are aggregated spatially or temporally, has multiple within-day measurements (e.g., a diel study), or are from a data-dense spatial study
Maximum measured CO2 flux if data are aggregated spatially or temporally, has multiple within-day measurements (e.g., a diel study), or are from a data-dense spatial study
Mean or sole reported CO2 diffusive flux for the sampling event
Standard deviation of the mean CO2 flux
Median CO2 flux
Methodological category used to measure CO2 flux. Categories are the same as those used for CH4 flux

codeDefinition.definition: chamber measurements
diffusive flux calculated using a gas exchange coefficient (k) and the difference between measured CH4 concentration and CH4 concentration in equilibrium with the atmosphere
chamber is unrestrained and is able to float downstream during flux measurement; the pattern of change in chamber gas concentration during flux measurements is not specified
methods other than those described above

attribute.attributeDefinition: Minimum measured N2O flux if data are aggregated spatially or temporally, has multiple within-day measurements (e.g., a diel study), or are from a data-dense spatial study
Maximum measured N2O flux if data are aggregated spatially or temporally, has multiple within-day measurements (e.g., a diel study), or are from a data-dense spatial study
Mean or sole reported N2O diffusive flux for the sampling event
Standard deviation of the mean N2O flux
Median N2O flux
Methodological category used for estimating the gas exchange coefficient, k,

codeDefinition.definition: use of k values from other dates or sites in the same study or k values considered to be characteristic of the site

k determined by chamber-based measurements of flux, dissolved gas concentration, and calculated as equation: k = (Cw-Ceq)/flux. Typically, these measurements are made for CO2, and kCO2 is then converted to kCH4
methods other than those described above
k calculated using equations based on physical variables such as channel slope, water velocity, etc.

k calculated using equations based on physical variables such as channel slope, water velocity, etc. and paired conservative solute and gas tracer additions used to calculate k from corrected gas concentration decline along a stream reach
paired conservative solute and gas tracer additions used to calculate k from corrected gas concentration decline along a stream reach

attribute.attributeDefinition: k method citation reported in the data source

textDomain.definition: k method citation reported in the data source

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique data source identifier from the Sources Table

textDomain.definition: Unique data source identifier from the Sources Table

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique site identifier

textDomain.definition: Unique site identifier

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique site name

textDomain.definition: Unique site name

attribute.attributeDefinition: Stream or river name; taken or modified from the data source or generated de novo when a name was not specified in the data source

textDomain.definition: Stream or river name; taken or modified from the data source or generated de novo when a name was not specified in the data source

attribute.attributeDefinition: Yes or No. Yes if CH4 data presented are averages from more than 1 site

codeDefinition.definition: no additional data were acquired directly from the author for any field
additional data were acquired directly from the author for any field

attribute.attributeDefinition: Number of sites that were averaged for aggregated sites
Name of the larger drainage basin or region that contains the site. This information is included to facilitate site grouping during data analysis

textDomain.definition: Name of the larger drainage basin or region that contains the site. This information is included to facilitate site grouping during data analysis

attribute.attributeDefinition: Decimal degrees, WGS84 ensemble: EPSG:4326 coordinate system
Decimal degrees, WGS84 ensemble: EPSG:4326 coordinate system
Reported meters above sea level
Reported channel slope expressed as m m-1
Reported Strahler stream order
Reported basin size in square kilometer
Codes denoting distinct site or channel attributes or presence of specified conditions.

codeDefinition.definition: Canal or other artificial channel with hardened channel boundaries
Canal or other artificial channel with hardened channel boundaries; Channel in a river delta
Canal or other artificial channel with hardened channel boundaries; Presence of multiple and typically small impoundments in a site’s vicinity (e.g., various European rivers, Mississippi River)
Canal or other artificial channel with hardened channel boundaries; Immediately (less than 1 km) downstream of a point source discharge
Channelized; a channel that has long straight-line sections and changes in channel direction are typically distinct angular features rather than curves

Channelized; a channel that has long straight-line sections and changes in channel direction are typically distinct angular features rather than curves; Downstream (within 7 km) of a dam. Samples from spillways were not included
Channel in a river delta
Channel in a river delta; Immediately (less than 1 km) downstream of a point source discharge
Downstream (within 7 km) of a dam. Samples from spillways were not included
Ditch, typically for agricultural drainage, without channel hardening

Site in a floodplain water body connected to the main channel that appears lentic or is described as a floodplain lake or backwater. This category does not include braided river side-channels within floodplains or tributary channels transecting a floodplain
Site below the toe or terminus of a glacier
Presence of multiple and typically small impoundments in a site’s vicinity (e.g., various European rivers, Mississippi River)

Presence of multiple and typically small impoundments in a site’s vicinity (e.g., various European rivers, Mississippi River); Channelized; a channel that has long straight-line sections and changes in channel direction are typically distinct angular features rather than curves
Permafrost influenced; this refers specifically to sites at or immediately below thermokarst outflows and not to sites in areas underlain with permafrost
Immediately (less than 1 km) downstream of a point source discharge
Immediately (less than 1 km) downstream of a point source discharge; Canal or other artificial channel with hardened channel boundaries

Immediately (less than 1 km) downstream of a point source discharge; Channelized; a channel that has long straight-line sections and changes in channel direction are typically distinct angular features rather than curves
Spring channel; this does not include sites characterized as seeps (features with low flow volume adjacent to channels)
Site receiving inputs of thermogenic CH4, either naturally or as a result of mining, fracking, oil extraction, and other related activities.
Wetland stream; site is in a wetland or immediately downstream from the outlet of a wetland

attribute.attributeDefinition: Latitude in decimal degrees for site location after snapping to the closest channel for elevation determination
Longitude in decimal degrees for site location after snapping to the closest channel for elevation determination
Elevation (meters above sea level) calculated from the DEM.
Additional information or clarification about the site source

textDomain.definition: Additional information or clarification about the site source
